definition[0]: to go and get something or someone and bring them back
example[0]: Quick! Go and fetch a doctor.
example[1]: Shannon went upstairs to fetch some blankets.
example[2]: Would you mind going to fetch the kids from school?
example[3]: Fetch me some coffee while you’re up.
note[1]: fetch somebody something/fetch something for somebody
definition[1]: to be sold for a particular amount of money, especially at a public sale – used especially in news reports
example[4]: The painting is expected to fetch at least $20 million.
definition[2]: to make people react in a particular way
example[5]: This announcement fetched a huge cheer from the audience.
